alert.note: Alert for North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:55PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Scotts Bluff, southwestern Sioux and northern Goshen Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 655 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Jay Em to near Fort Laramie. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Prairie Center, Jay Em, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Agate Bed National Monument, Henry and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
